options.name: cgit.configText
options.desc: Verbatim contents of the cgit runtime configuration file.Documentation (with cgitrc example file) is available in “man cgitrc”.Or online:  http://git.zx2c4.com/cgit/tree/cgitrc.5.txt

options.name: cgit.enable
options.desc: If true, enable cgit (fast web interface for git repositories) as asub-service in lighttpd.

options.name: cgit.subdir
options.desc: The subdirectory in which to serve cgit. The web application will beaccessible at http://yourserver/${subdir}

options.name: collectd.collectionCgi
options.desc: Path to collection.cgi script from (collectdsources)/contrib/collection.cgi This option allows to use a customizedversion

options.name: collectd.enable
options.desc: Whether to enable collectd subservice accessible athttp://yourserver/collectd.

options.name: configText
options.desc: Overridable config file contents to use for lighttpd. By default, usethe contents automatically generated by NixOS.

options.name: document-root
options.desc: Document-root of the web server. Must be readable by the “lighttpd”user.

options.name: enableModules
options.desc: List of lighttpd modules to enable. Sub-services take care ofenabling modules as needed, so this option is mainly for when you wantto add custom stuff to  services.lighttpd.extraConfig  that depends on acertain module.

options.name: enableUpstreamMimeTypes
options.desc: Whether to include the list of mime types bundled with lighttpd(upstream). If you disable this, no mime types will be added by NixOSand you will have to add your own mime types in  services.lighttpd.extraConfig .

options.name: extraConfig
options.desc: These configuration lines will be appended to the generated lighttpdconfig file. Note that this mechanism does not work when the manual configText  option isused.

options.name: gitweb.enable
options.desc: If true, enable gitweb in lighttpd. Access it athttp://yourserver/gitweb

options.name: mod_status
options.desc: Show server status overview at /server-status, statistics at/server-statistics and list of loaded modules at /server-config.

options.name: mod_userdir
options.desc: If true, requests in the form /~user/page.html are rewritten to takethe file public_html/page.html from the home directory of the user.

options.name: port
options.desc: TCP port number for lighttpd to bind to.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)
